title: Ott & Murphy 2013 Boushey Vineyard Marsanne (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Volatility provides distraction from the almond and peach aromas. The palate dips in the middle and seems to need more oomph.

title: Laurence Féraud 2015 Pink Pégau Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This rosé, made from 70% Cinsault, 20% Grenache and 10% Clairette, offers upfront notes of stone fruit that are laced with hints of menthol, savory herbs and muddled red berry on the nose. The palate is sharp and astringent, with tart flavors of rhubarb and currant.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The entry-level wine from the Gueissard family, this is light, fresh and crisp. With its lively red-berry fruits and lifted acidity, it is accessible and bright. It finishes with a bright shot of citrus.

title: Seven Terraces 2014 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)
description: Appealing notes of cedar and vanilla mark the nose, but unfortunately this wine lacks the richness of fruit to fully support them. Tart cherry fruit fades quickly on the finish.

title: Vignobles Ravel 2015 Château Montaud Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is lightly earthy, although gentle and with attractive red and citrus fruits. It has bright acidity and a lively, simple, open aftertaste.

title: Trinitas 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aged in new Russian oak, this wine comes off as slightly sweet and quite tropical, with an essence of fuzzy apricot and toasted wood.

title: Voiturette 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: There is a distinct herbal, green character to this wine. That combines with a light, juicy texture and crisp acidity to make it totally ready to drink.

title: Estandon 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This easy, crisp wine is fruity, fresh with acidity and ready to drink as an apéritif.

title: Zolo 2014 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of prune and cocoa powder accurately portend a chunky, plodding palate with flat tannins. This is at maximum ripeness, but it's not totally balanced, as raisin, mint and black pepper flavors finish with heat and herbal notes.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: Château Maupague 2015 Cabaret Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The palest pink in color, this wine is light and easy with the merest hint of fruitiness and acidity. Red currant and lime mark the finish.

title: Albada 2013 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Aromas of jammy, candied berry fruits and wet dog fur amount to a murky whole. This is high in acidity, with a mishmash of berry and creamy, plastic-like flavors. A smear of oak dominates the finish.

title: Belle Made For You NV White (Vin de France)
description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Grenache Blanc is light and fresh. Gently fruity, hinting at herbs and citrus and with an easy, open texture, it is a soft quaffing wine. The aftertaste is lightly sweet.

title: Château Coussin 2015 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With earthy, rustic aromas that translate onto the palate, this wine seems to miss out on some of the fruitiness normally associated with rosés. A few more months in bottle may help.

title: Grandissime 2015 So Shellfish Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: This is a soft wine, almost off dry. It is perfumed with candy aromas and flavors of pineapple and citrus. Light and clean, it will be an attractive apéritif.

title: Madrigal 2012 Barberis Family Reserve Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: There's a middle-of-the-road softness to this wine, which attempts to conjure elements of feral blackberry and blueberry, but falls flat in the middle.

title: Mar de Envero 2013 Troupe Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fruitless aromas suggest oyster shell and old apples. This maintains snap and relative balance on the palate, but tastes heavy and burnt. Not sure if this oaked or not, but whatever the case, it's just barely hanging in there.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This pure Syrah rosé is fat and plump with ripe raspberry fruits. It has a tang and light pepper although its attractive fruit and acidity dominate. The candy-shop aftertaste is less appealing.

title: Le Pépin 2015 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)
description: Fresh and easy, this dainty rosé opens with fresh scents of strawberry, cherry, watermelon rind and soft orange blossom. The juicy palate offers more of the same in a clean and approachable manner, finishing short but refreshing. Drink up.

title: Le Val 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)
description: Floral tones of carnation and purple violet are upfront on the nose, followed closely by ripe, jammy fruit notes of raspberry, plum and blackberry that follow through to the softly structured palate. A touch of milk chocolate adds decadence, but the finish fades fast.

title: Legado del Fraile 2013 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny, pickled aromas include a hint of apple. Linear and acidic on the palate, but without much else noteworthy, this fading Albariño tastes rather sour and bitter, which is also how it finishes.

title: Michel Gassier 2015 A Capella White (Vin de France)
description: A blend of Colombard and Viognier, this has the lightness and crispness of a wine from the cool southwest vineyards of France. It is herbal, flavored with gooseberries and with tight, mineral acidity. The wine, with its light touch, is ready to drink.

title: Rodney Strong 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Smoke and oak lounge around heartier notions of black pepper and leather in this soft, approachable wine with vague accents of cedar and herb. Lengthy on the palate, its awash in firm tannin and blackberry-vanilla.

title: Voiturette 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Named after the iconic Citroën 2 CV car, this wine is soft, gently fruity without great definition. It offers some ripe apricot flavors along with touches of spice and pepper. The wine is easy, ready to drink.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2013 Left Tusque Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Austere in fruit with a strong essence of leather satchel and rustic truffle, this wine is light bodied, unfussy and quite lean.

title: Trinitas 2013 Rose'Ary Rosé (California)
description: There's a harshness of tannin that hits first, blocking any taste of fruit, before this big-bodied, slightly sour wine takes on notions of plum and black cherry.

title: Café du Midi 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Direct and straightforward, this leads with scents of black plum and cherry that are laced with a licorice accent. The palate offers more green flavors of blackcurrant leaf and peppercorn, framed by astringent but fleeting tannins.

title: Bonterra 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Simple flavors like a fruit salad and a rather soft texture make for a basic wine that's easy on the palate.

title: Château de Brigue 2015 Brun Estate Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: One of a series of entry-level wines from this estate, this is soft, only lightly fruity and rounded at the end. It has a lively, bright aftertaste.

title: Fire Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: When vintages are difficult, as 2014 was, it's often most apparent in a region's entry level wines. This wine is simply lacking in concentration, offering little more than tart cherries and delicate herbal notes. Drink now.

title: Romantic 2015 Authentic & Chic Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: Bright blueberry, raspberry and strawberry lead the nose of this fresh and fruity wine, while a subtle hint of chocolate dances in the background. The palate is slightly tense and nervy, with tart cherry and currant flavors that carry through to the close.
